intro: Cochranea conferta var. auriculata, commonly known as the auriculate cochranea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in the spring. It is often found in rocky or coastal habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its unique leaf morphology and habitat preferences make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
